title: >>> Who's GOING to 50?
body_text:
It has been a question raised for a long, long time, one that obviously will see an answer in one month time: "Who will be captain(s) at DODGEBALL 50?"
It will have to wait another week ...
In the Spotlight
Sara DeCuir perhaps picked up her most crucial win ever defeating iron woman Diana DiBuccio at DODGEBALL 46.
With her win came the next set of challengers, all looking to be called captains "champion". Her first challenger, much like herself prior to DODGEBALL 46, has never won a captains battle.
Just the name alone turns heads. Derek Carty is one of the most athletically-gifted competitors ever, and to some, it may come as a surprise that he has yet to win as a captain. You can bet he looks to turn that very bad luck into something very positive.
As DODGEBALL 50 approaches, it will always be in question who the rival captains will be come that August 4th night. Two challengers have already been named for the forthcoming events; Kevin Adams at DODGEBALL 48, and John Tronolone at DODGEBALL 49.
- Who will go into DODGEBALL 50 as the reigning champion?
It's all between Sara DeCuir, Derek Carty, Kevin Adams, and John Tronolone. After DODGEBALL 47, scratch off one of them from the list.
DODGEBALL 50: Wall High School vs. Ocean Road Park
DODGEBALL 50, easily the biggest one of them all, is scheduled to take place at its birthplace, Ocean Road Park. However, many in the dodgeball world have spoke up against the idea for the mere fact that past ORP events have been poor (as well possible equipment loss).
This has certainly brought up mixed feelings from a good number of players, more so the regulars. What will be done in the coming weeks is a simple vote to decide once and for all where DODGEBALL 50 will emanate.
DODGEBALL 50 is Friday, August 4th. The weather for this event MUST be good* or it will canceled. A postponement date has yet to be decided.
*
Good
as no rain.*
body_html:
It has been a question raised for a long, long time, one that obviously will see an answer in one month time: "Who will be captain(s) at DODGEBALL 50?"

It will have to wait another week ...

In the Spotlight
Sara DeCuir perhaps picked up her most crucial win ever defeating iron woman Diana DiBuccio at DODGEBALL 46.

With her win came the next set of challengers, all looking to be called captains "champion". Her first challenger, much like herself prior to DODGEBALL 46, has never won a captains battle.

Just the name alone turns heads. Derek Carty is one of the most athletically-gifted competitors ever, and to some, it may come as a surprise that he has yet to win as a captain. You can bet he looks to turn that very bad luck into something very positive.

As DODGEBALL 50 approaches, it will always be in question who the rival captains will be come that August 4th night. Two challengers have already been named for the forthcoming events; Kevin Adams at DODGEBALL 48, and John Tronolone at DODGEBALL 49.

- Who will go into DODGEBALL 50 as the reigning champion?
It's all between Sara DeCuir, Derek Carty, Kevin Adams, and John Tronolone. After DODGEBALL 47, scratch off one of them from the list.

DODGEBALL 50: Wall High School vs. Ocean Road Park
DODGEBALL 50, easily the biggest one of them all, is scheduled to take place at its birthplace, Ocean Road Park. However, many in the dodgeball world have spoke up against the idea for the mere fact that past ORP events have been poor (as well possible equipment loss).

This has certainly brought up mixed feelings from a good number of players, more so the regulars. What will be done in the coming weeks is a simple vote to decide once and for all where DODGEBALL 50 will emanate.

DODGEBALL 50 is Friday, August 4th. The weather for this event MUST be good* or it will canceled. A postponement date has yet to be decided.

*Good as no rain.*
